meanings.definition: A type of footwear consisting of a sole fastened to the foot by straps.
meanings.sent1: She wore comfortable petasuses during her long walks.
meanings.sent2: The gladiator fastened his petasuses securely before entering the arena.
meanings.sent3: The petasuses made her feet feel like they were walking on clouds.
meanings.sent4: His petasuses were like armor for his tired feet after a day of work.
meanings.sent5: The colorful petasuses stood out in the crowd, catching everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: A type of headgear worn by ancient Greek travelers to protect against the sun.
meanings.sent1: The traveler put on his petasuses to shield his face from the scorching sun.
meanings.sent2: The petasuses provided much-needed shade during the long journey.
meanings.sent3: Her petasuses made her look like a wise explorer ready for an adventure.
meanings.sent4: The petasuses cast a shadow over his face, giving him a mysterious air.
meanings.sent5: The golden petasuses gleamed in the sunlight, adding a touch of elegance to his outfit.

meanings.definition: A type of garment worn by ancient Greek women, consisting of a long piece of cloth draped around the body.
meanings.sent1: She gracefully wrapped the petasuses around her body, creating an elegant look.
meanings.sent2: The flowing petasuses fluttered in the breeze as she walked.
meanings.sent3: Her colorful petasuses billowed like a sail in the wind, drawing attention.
meanings.sent4: The soft fabric of the petasuses enveloped her in comfort and style.
meanings.sent5: The intricate patterns on the petasuses added a touch of sophistication to her attire.
